UX Improvements

ğŸ‘‰ Keyboard Shortcuts

  • Allow component types to capture keyboard events to trigger actions.
  • I.e. Ctrl+â€+â€ in list item may add new item below (trigger addItem action with that item as target).
  • I.e. Ctrl+â€-â€œ in list item may remove the item containing it (trigger removeItem action with that item as target).

ğŸ’¡ Implement UNDO component.

  • Contains single component (form, list, inputâ€¦).
  • Acts as a â€œman in the middleâ€.
  • Listen to the (future) componentâ€™s â€œchangeâ€ events to capture (export) and store changes.

ğŸ’¡ Implement Table Of Contents component.

  • Scan targetted component recursively.
  • Refresh on every change (add or remove items).
  • Show only components with a â€œtoc-sectionâ€ property.
  • Allow navigating to every secton through their (full path) idâ€™s.
  • Implement a â€œreturn to TOCâ€ actions.

Spare Ideas

Spare (not yet mature) random ideasâ€¦

Implement download action

  • Implement in lib/component.js.
  • Rely on (each type)â€™s export action.
  • Allow to specify file name (maybe even promptâ€¦)
  • Downloads (exported) json by default
  • â€¦but allow for transformation filters to generate other kinds of data from json input.

Sample code for download fuctionality:

function download(fileName, payload, ctype = "text/plain", charset="utf-8") {
    var dldAnchor = document.createElement('a');
    dldAnchor.setAttribute('href', `data:${ctype};charset=${charset},${encodeURIComponent(payload)}`);
    dldAnchor.setAttribute('download', fileName);
    dldAnchor.style.display = 'none';
    document.body.appendChild(dldAnchor);
    dldAnchor.click();
    document.body.removeChild(dldAnchor);
}

// Usage example
download(myFile.json, {foo: "bar"});
